intro: Pterolepis piatensis, commonly known as the Piatense Broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
